id: Bx - Networking Wellington Central - Business Networking in New Zealand- Willis Street Wellington, Wellington-Event Brite
name: Bx - Networking Wellington Central - Business Networking in New Zealand
description:
Bx - Business Networking Reimagined is a fun, social, dynamic and productive networking event, designed to help your business grow through referrals and business opportunities.
As a member, you can attend ANY and as MANY as you like!
We are the FASTEST GROWING business networking community in Australia, both face-to-face AND online.
We help you GET RESULTS in your networking.
80% of the meeting is spent getting to know other business owners.

description:
Class Description Hatha yoga helps to purify the physical, energetic and mental layers of our being and thus creates more harmonious conditions for Self-reconnection.
Hridaya Hatha Yoga is a form of classical Hatha Yoga practiced in a contemplative style.
What to Bring You’re welcome to bring your own equipment with you.
When we return to the heart of our being, we return home to our true self.
He has also completed four additional yoga modules at the school and various other group and solitary retreats across the world.

id: Hutt Valley (Upper Hutt/Lower Hutt) Mathematics Leadership Community 2025- Kauri Street Lower Hutt, Wellington-Event Brite
name: Hutt Valley (Upper Hutt/Lower Hutt) Mathematics Leadership Community 2025
description:
Are you the maths lead in your school?
Register to join our Mathematics Leadership Community (MLC) and build your mathematics and statistics knowledge and leadership skills.
These MLC’s have been supporting mathematics leaders and teachers for over 18 years and we are excited to offer you the opportunity to be part of this network in 2025, which is shaping up to be a pivotal year in mathematics education.
Through engaging with current research and best practice, these meetings will enable leaders and teachers to: stay up to date with changes and implement Te Mātaiaho, Mathematics and Statistics Curriculum build capability in leading mathematics and statistics within and across their school investigate effective pedagogy and strategies for teaching and assessing mathematics and statistics connect and network with other leaders and teachers.
$350 for a 2025 Membership (+gst and booking fees) $100 for 1 meeting (+gst and booking fees) *Each ticket purchased gives entry for two attendees from 1 school* For any Kāhui Ako interested in this series, please contact us at info@cognitioneducation.com.

id: CEP's New Zealand Rural Education Study Tour 2025-Ray Emery Drive Māngere,-Event Brite
name: CEP's New Zealand Rural Education Study Tour 2025
description:
Please note: This event is now fully booked.
Join the CEP team for an 8-day study tour across New Zealand, focusing on rural education.
Participants will engage with local schools, learn more about indigenous-led education practices and meet with key educational leaders.
Wellington: Participate in workshops, connect with cluster schools and meet with peak education bodies such as the New Zealand Educational Institute (NZEI), Primary & Secondary Teacher Unions (PPTA) and Ministry of Education National Office Leaders.
Please submit your expression of interest to learn more.

id: It's in the Ballot-MDC - Saturday 23rd August Production Day Pass-In-studio- Dixon Street Masterton, Wellington Region-Event Brite
name: It's in the Ballot-MDC - Saturday 23rd August Production Day Pass-In-studio
description:
Contestants of 'It's in the Bag' become political candidates in 'It's in the Ballot' Meet the Candidates.
Candidates choose a numbered box which has a question that has been submitted online by voters before the show.
It’s in the Ballot” is a community-led awareness and participation initiative.
We aim to increase voter interest in the general and council elections nationally.
By using broadcasting and web-based technologies to deliver in-studio; online on Facebook, YouTube and Twitch; and edited as YouTube videos we aim to enable voters to make informed voting decisions.

id: COFFEE & CLAY Hand build your own ceramic butter dish- Tinakori Road Wellington, Wellington-Event Brite
name: COFFEE & CLAY Hand build your own ceramic butter dish
description:
Join us for a relaxed, hands-on workshop where you'll create your very own ceramic butter dish in a working pottery studio.
Over two inspiring hours, you'll learn the basics of hand-building with clay, guided step-by-step by a ceramic artist.
Enjoy fresh coffee and a home-baked morning tea as you get creative with shaping, decorating, and embellishing your piece.
You'll finish by choosing your preferred glaze colours, and we'll take care of the firing process.
Your finished butter dish will be ready to collect approximately four weeks later.

id: Harry Potter Quiz @ Upper Hutt Cossie Club, Upper Hutt- Logan Street Upper Hutt, Wellington Region-Event Brite
name: Harry Potter Quiz @ Upper Hutt Cossie Club, Upper Hutt
venue: Logan Street Upper Hutt, Wellington Region
description:
Harry Potter Quiz @ Upper Hutt Cossie Club Gee Quiz is back with a brand new Harry Potter quiz for 2025!
Put your knowledge to the test at our Harry Potter Quiz event!
Not only will teams be playing for an awesome swathe of prizes, the winners will book a place in the National Championship Harry Potter Quiz held later in the year!
This event WILL likely sell out, so get in fast to secure your table!
Book your team ticket here -> https://www.trybooking.com/nz/XWI Once you book, you will receive an automated email with a link to a Google Form where you will be required to enter your team name.

Class Description Hatha yoga helps to purify the physical, energetic and mental layers of our being and thus creates more harmonious conditions for Self-reconnection.
Hridaya Hatha Yoga is a form of classical Hatha Yoga practiced in a contemplative style.
What to Bring You’re welcome to bring your own equipment with you.
When we return to the heart of our being, we return home to our true self.
He has also completed four additional yoga modules at the school and various other group and solitary retreats across the world.

id: The Parting Glass - Wellington Male Voice Choir- Hobson Street Wellington, Wellington-Event Brite
name: The Parting Glass - Wellington Male Voice Choir
description:
Join us to fill your “Parting Glass” as we draw down the curtain on 64 years of male choral singing by the Wellington Male Voice Choir.
Our final concert will celebrate our rich and active history, drawing on much-loved favourites, and some new songs, that show off the unique qualities of male voice harmony.
This is your last chance to hear the Wellington Male Voice Choir, and we’d love you to join us in a final celebration of good company and cherished memories.

id: Wellington Audio Tour: A Wellington Audio Adventure-Embassy Theatre, Wellington Kent Terrace Wellington,-Event Brite
name: Wellington Audio Tour: A Wellington Audio Adventure
venue: Embassy Theatre, Wellington Kent Terrace Wellington,
description:
Step into the soul of Wellington with our immersive self-guided audio tour.
🗺️ Tour Details Duration: 1 hour 18 minutes Distance: Around 4.4 km (2.7 miles) Audio Content: up to 16min Stops: 8 captivating landmarks including Te Papa, Courtenay Place, Wellington, Toi Pōneke Arts Centre Experience the charm of Wellington like never before.
Enter the code, and you're all set to explore Wellington on your terms.
👥 Who's It For?
📍 Tour Stops You will visit the following locations: 🎭  Embassy Theatre, Wellington (1min) 🪣  Courtenay Place, Wellington (1min) ⛲  Bucket Fountain (1min) 🎨  Toi Pōneke Arts Centre (1min) 🏠  McGavin House (1min) 🗿  Quasi (sculpture) (1min) 📍  Te Papa (1min) 🎨  Carter Fountain (2min) Each stop features engaging audio stories that bring the location's history and significance to life.

id: From Galileo to Laudato Si’: Why Science Needs Faith - Br. Guy Consolmagno- Bunny Street Wellington, Wellington Region-Event Brite
name: From Galileo to Laudato Si’: Why Science Needs Faith - Br. Guy Consolmagno
description:
This event is also available online on Zoom.
(No ticket required).
How we understand faith and science has changed radically from the time of Galileo, as can be seen in how Pope Francis blended science and faith in his encyclical Laudato Si’.
Its key insight is that our science, and the technology it spawns, is deeply connected to the flawed but redeemable human persons who do the science, and who make and live with technology... and its consequences Br.
He is known for his research on meteorites, asteroids, and the evolution of small solar system bodies, as well as his popular writings on astronomy and faith.

These MLC’s have been supporting mathematics leaders and teachers for over 18 years and we are excited to offer you the opportunity to be part of this network in 2025, which is shaping up to be a pivotal year in mathematics education.
Through engaging with current research and best practice, these meetings will enable leaders and teachers to: stay up to date with changes and implement Te Mātaiaho, Mathematics and Statistics Curriculum build capability in leading mathematics and statistics within and across their school investigate effective pedagogy and strategies for teaching and assessing mathematics and statistics connect and network with other leaders and teachers.
$350 for a 2025 Membership (+gst and booking fees) $100 for 1 meeting (+gst and booking fees) *Each ticket purchased gives entry for two attendees from 1 school* For any Kāhui Ako interested in this series, please contact us at info@cognitioneducation.com.

id: From Galileo to Laudato Si’: Why Science Needs Faith - Br. Guy Consolmagno- Bunny Street Wellington, Wellington Region-Event Brite
name: From Galileo to Laudato Si’: Why Science Needs Faith - Br. Guy Consolmagno
description:
This event is also available online on Zoom.
(No ticket required).
How we understand faith and science has changed radically from the time of Galileo, as can be seen in how Pope Francis blended science and faith in his encyclical Laudato Si’.
Its key insight is that our science, and the technology it spawns, is deeply connected to the flawed but redeemable human persons who do the science, and who make and live with technology... and its consequences Br.
He is known for his research on meteorites, asteroids, and the evolution of small solar system bodies, as well as his popular writings on astronomy and faith.

id: Wellington Audio Tour: A Wellington Audio Adventure-Embassy Theatre, Wellington Kent Terrace Wellington,-Event Brite
name: Wellington Audio Tour: A Wellington Audio Adventure
venue: Embassy Theatre, Wellington Kent Terrace Wellington,
description:
Step into the soul of Wellington with our immersive self-guided audio tour.
🗺️ Tour Details Duration: 1 hour 18 minutes Distance: Around 4.4 km (2.7 miles) Audio Content: up to 16min Stops: 8 captivating landmarks including Te Papa, Courtenay Place, Wellington, Toi Pōneke Arts Centre Experience the charm of Wellington like never before.
Enter the code, and you're all set to explore Wellington on your terms.
👥 Who's It For?
📍 Tour Stops You will visit the following locations: 🎭  Embassy Theatre, Wellington (1min) 🪣  Courtenay Place, Wellington (1min) ⛲  Bucket Fountain (1min) 🎨  Toi Pōneke Arts Centre (1min) 🏠  McGavin House (1min) 🗿  Quasi (sculpture) (1min) 📍  Te Papa (1min) 🎨  Carter Fountain (2min) Each stop features engaging audio stories that bring the location's history and significance to life.

id: COFFEE & CLAY Hand build your own ceramic butter dish- Tinakori Road Wellington, Wellington-Event Brite
name: COFFEE & CLAY Hand build your own ceramic butter dish
description:
Join us for a relaxed, hands-on workshop where you'll create your very own ceramic butter dish in a working pottery studio.
Over two inspiring hours, you'll learn the basics of hand-building with clay, guided step-by-step by a ceramic artist.
Enjoy fresh coffee and a home-baked morning tea as you get creative with shaping, decorating, and embellishing your piece.
You'll finish by choosing your preferred glaze colours, and we'll take care of the firing process.
Your finished butter dish will be ready to collect approximately four weeks later.

id: Harry Potter Quiz @ Upper Hutt Cossie Club, Upper Hutt- Logan Street Upper Hutt, Wellington Region-Event Brite
name: Harry Potter Quiz @ Upper Hutt Cossie Club, Upper Hutt
venue: Logan Street Upper Hutt, Wellington Region
description:
Harry Potter Quiz @ Upper Hutt Cossie Club Gee Quiz is back with a brand new Harry Potter quiz for 2025!
Put your knowledge to the test at our Harry Potter Quiz event!
Not only will teams be playing for an awesome swathe of prizes, the winners will book a place in the National Championship Harry Potter Quiz held later in the year!
This event WILL likely sell out, so get in fast to secure your table!
Book your team ticket here -> https://www.trybooking.com/nz/XWI Once you book, you will receive an automated email with a link to a Google Form where you will be required to enter your team name.

id: Hridaya Hatha Yoga with Adam- Trafalgar Street #Level One Nelson, Nelson Region-Event Brite
name: Hridaya Hatha Yoga with Adam
venue: Trafalgar Street #Level One Nelson, Nelson Region
description:
Class Description Hatha yoga helps to purify the physical, energetic and mental layers of our being and thus creates more harmonious conditions for Self-reconnection.
Hridaya Hatha Yoga is a form of classical Hatha Yoga practiced in a contemplative style.
What to Bring You’re welcome to bring your own equipment with you.
When we return to the heart of our being, we return home to our true self.
He has also completed four additional yoga modules at the school and various other group and solitary retreats across the world.
